body:
Hello!

I am hoping to be able to do something like this:

``` bash
./bin/spack repo add /path/to/site-repo
./bin/spack create -r site-repo https://internal.gitlab/coolpackage-1.2.3tgz
```

But the create command fails with this message:

```
==> Error: No repo.yaml found in 'site-repo'
```

However, I would argue that I do in fact have a repo.yaml file in the `/path/to/site-repo` folder with these contents:

``` yaml
repo:
  namespace: 'site-repo'
```

However, if I manually copy a created package into the 'site-repo' folder, I am able to install it just fine.
title: Creating packages in external repos seems not to work
